data.title: Meet Princess Beatrice and Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi’s children, Sienna and Christopher: the royal’s daughter was partly named after Queen Elizabeth, and stepson Wolfie’s mum is the ultra glam Dara Huang
data.meta_description: Prince Andrew’s eldest daughter Beatrice has a daughter and a stepson with husband Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi – but do the children get to see their controversial grandfather?
data.text:
This came on the heels of an even more enamoured post in August 2022: “You are the world’s best wife,” Mapelli Mozzi gushed. “Along with this, you are the best mother in the world.”

So who are Princess Beatrice’s and Mapelli Mozzi’s children? And do they spend any time with their grandparents, including the disgraced Prince Andrew? Here’s everything we know.

Princess Beatrice is married to an Italian count

Edoardo is a member of the Italian nobility; his father is Count Alessandro Mapelli Mozzi. As previously reported, Edoardo founded London-based property development firm Banda in 2007 at age 23, and he continues to hold the role of its CEO, per his LinkedIn.

They share a daughter, Sienna Elizabeth

Princess Beatrice also has a stepson, Christopher Woolf

Two-year-old Sienna has an older half-brother in Christopher Woolf, Mapelli Mozzi’s son with his ex, Dara Huang.

Christopher Woolf – better known as Wolfie – is seven years old and, according to People, Beatrice has been very involved with him since he was a toddler.

“Beatrice has embraced the child as part of her life from the outset,” a friend of the princess reportedly told the magazine in 2019. When it came time for Beatrice and her count to marry, Wolfie was the couple’s page boy and was even his father’s best man, per the publication.

Who is Wolfie’s biological mum, Dara Huang?

Glamorous, Harvard-educated Huang is an architect and interior designer. People reported that Wolfie’s mum previously split her time between London and Hong Kong; however, these days her Instagram suggests that she spends most of her time between London and Miami.

She has appeared as an expert and judge respectively on the reality television shows Britain’s Most Expensive Houses and The Big Interiors Battle.

Do Sienna and Wolfie hang out with other royals?

But do the children ever see their controversial grandfather, Prince Andrew?

According to British media, despite the furore surrounding their father, Princesses Beatrice and Eugenie are still close to him – as is his ex-wife and their mother, who still stays with the disgraced prince at the Royal Lodge in Windsor Great Park.

Given that Ferguson often talks publicly about how much time she spends with her grandchildren at the Royal Lodge – including telling Hello! that she has to rearrange the furniture each time they visit – it seems clear that the kids must get to spend time with their grandad too.
